gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਟੂਟੇ ਨਾਗਬੇਲ ਸੈ ਬਿਦੇਸ ਜਾਤਿ ਸਲਲਿ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਚਿਰੰਕਾਲ ਜੁਗਵਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tootay Naagabayl Sai Bidays Jaati , Salali Sanjog Chirankaal Jougavat Hai ?
translation: Just as betel leaves plucked from the creeper are sent to distant places and if kept in damp cloth remains useful for long,

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕੂੰਜ ਬਚਰਾ ਤਿਅਾਗ ਦਿਸੰਤਰਿ ਜਾਤਿ ਸਿਮਰਨ ਚਿਤਿ ਨਿਰਬਿਘਨ ਰਹਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Koonj Bacharaa Tiaag Disantari Jaati , Simaran Chiti Nirabighan Rahat Hai ?
translation: Just as a crane deposits her young ones and fly out to distant land but always remember them in her mind as a result of which they remain alive and grow,

gurmukhi: ਗੰਗੋਦਿਕ ਜੈਸੇ ਭਰਿ ਭਾਂਜਨ ਲੈ ਜਾਤਿ ਜਾਤ੍ਰੀ ਸੁਜਸੁ ਅਧਾਰ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਨਿਬਹਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gangodik Jaisay Bhari Bhaanjan Lai Jaati Jaatree , Sujasu Adhaar Niramal Nibahat Hai ?
translation: Just as travellers carry water of river Ganges in their container, and being of superior disposition it stays good for long,

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਸਿਖ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਕੈ ਜੀਅਤ ਹੈ ॥੫੧੫॥
transliteration: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Antari Sikha , Sabadu Sangati Gur Dhiaan Kai Jeeat Hai ?515?
translation: Similarly if a Sikh of the True Guru somehow get separated from his Guru, he remains invigorated by virtue of holy congregation, meditation on His name and contemplating and focusing his mind in the holy feet of his True Guru.  (515)
